name: Shakes and Fidget
description: Shakes and Fidget is a fun fantasy RPG satire and an award-winning role-playing game at the same time! Sounds crazy? Over 50 million players make it one of the most popular online games in the world!Customize your own comic book hero and conquer the top slot of the Hall of Fame!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Intel Pentium or compatible Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 100 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Just bought a 1,000$ pc and i'm playing this game  10/10  PostData: everybody that criticizes this game dont have more than an hour played check it out by yourselves

I used to play Shakes and Fidget in a browser when they first started. I was still underaged and this was a game I looked forward too after school, playing together with your classmates and rek them obviously. I quit a long time ago, went to high school and needed to set priorities.   Well, now it's at Steam I came back and I made a new account because I forgot my old one, surprise. Even I have to start over it's still a great game. Yes, you've to wait at things like people complain but ever thought about letting it run while you play another game? Easily solved. The game is easy to understand and there is competition to be the best.

well the bad reviews doesn`t even understand the game and don`t have any decent hours to play, yeah it is f2p and can be boost by real money (mushroom), but its not really P2W just play smart and give it a shot (only spend mushroom for stable)

More like Flakes & Midget Well no actually, it's okay but it's too waity and grindy for my tastes. I didn't play for long but i made extensive research and supposedly it takes several aeons to get to level where something actually happens. I aaaaaaain't dancing that dance.  I'm recommending it because structurally it's okay, i'm just too casual and spastic to focus on anything that doesn't reward you with candy every five minutes.

Shakes and Fidget is a free to play animated 2D style RPG with multiplayer and everything RNG. It is also a web browser and mobile game, so it will be populated with other players. It worked, looked ok, sounded ok, played ok, was understandable. The levelcap is 550, but it will take you long time to reach it. Mushrooms are the store currency, but you can earn some from in quests rewards and gambling. Some gear cost mushrooms, but you might find the same and better later for gold only or quest reward. You can spend mushrooms to skip waiting on timers or add time to questing endurance and the best mount. You do need to buy mushrooms to level your guild past 25.  It has PVP and PVE. It is RNG combat where better stats and gear will give you the edge, but RNG is a fickle goddess, you still can lose to bad rolls. You can make three characters, using 3 classes ( warrior, mage, scout). You can raise your all your stats with gold and use potions to temporary improve a stat. It has 16 dungeons you can unlock and raid. At level 75, you can collect Pets that improve your stats and you can fight other players pets. There are other things that you can do to improve your stats.    You can make your own fortresss, with some buildings that improve your character. You can raid other players forts for resources and pour your gold in to defending your fort. It has Guilds and guild wars, where guild members all attack other guilds or defend from other guild's attacks. Guilds have stuff they can build that improves the lives of guild members. But above level 25 guild upgrades require someone that buys mushrooms.  Try it, maybe you might like it.   For more info:         YouTube™ Video:  Shakes and Fidget Gameplay - First Look HD

As many people may have said in the negative reviews, this is a waiting game, well yes, if you watch the video It clearly shows what type of game this is, it's a simple, fun and addicting game (for me) which you can let it be on background while you do something else, while you do have to wait to do quests, you do have arena which is using your character to fight other random characters in pvp, there are also guilds in which you can make raids and pvp another guild to go up in ranks and honor or challenge a guild dungeon, which you also have for your character, solo dungeons, which may give you drops of high items(or not depends on your luck) or just lots of exp and gold, although there are mounts which reduces the time for quests in the tavern, only the last ones you buy with mushrooms, now mushrooms the other currency ingame besides gold, yes it can be bough with real money, but I have played in many servers and never have I felt that I was worst than someone that bought them specially when while doing quests, there is a chance of getting mushrooms, for example the last mount costs 25 mushrooms which you begin with, that mount lasts for 25 days in 25 days of quests there is no way you won't get 25 mushrooms again on quest drops, all in all I hope this review helps someone decide whether this game is worth a shot or not, for me, it's pretty fun.  Someone also said this game was greedy? because the lowest he could pay is 9,99 for 130 mushrooms(which btw are alot), no the lowest is for 4,99 for 50 mushrooms and I am sure i remember shakes and fidgets sending me emails on holidays like thanksgiving, valentines day etc giving me free mushrooms so no, this game is everything but greedy.  TL:DR; It's cool, not buy to win, meh why not?

This is something I like to call a ''Alt-Tab'' game, in which you just put stuff loading and if it is finished, you come back to it and queue something more to it. Of course you cant do this infinitely without spending money on microtransactions to buy in-game currency. But it is still free, and you dont even have to press a button per minute to play it. It can run on anything and the artstyle is quite nice.

Usually games like this don't appeal to me, but this game is a major exception! It has amazing art, the humor is great and it isn't so time consuming as games like this tend to be at some point, it's exactly what this genre of games should be - log in for 5 to 10 mins. then leave the game do its job, while you do your work or whatever it is you are doing.  Overall this game is amazing. I'm giving it a 10/10. Love it. Even before it came to 'Steam'. It's most definitely worth checking out.  P.S. It's NOT pay-to-win!!!

Yeah as most people say its a time-waiting game.But if you think that you just press a button and then wait for the time to pass,then you are a noob or have played the game only for some minutes.You get to choose the quest out of 3 that are between 5-20 minutes each with no mounts,or from 3-15 minutes with the mount that costs 1 muchroom.Muchrooms are randomly droped from quests.I once had 50 muchroom always using mount so its easy to obtain.plus mount costs 1 muchroom for 5 days.Then you can fight every 10 minutes in the arena.You can do solo dungeons every one hour with epic loot.you can fight the tower every one hour too.You can fight the gate of demons every day once.You can build your own castle with materials your kingdom gathers.The buildings you have are:Walls,mage tower,blacksmith,archery,houses,barracks,wood gather,stone gatherer,castle,academy,storehouse and mine.You can attack other castles to steal resources.You can also upgrade all soldiers and guild banner.Oh yes you become a part of a guild.You attack other guilds and you do team dungeons too.You can chat with guild mates.Also there are stores that sell stuff like armor weapons and potions.You also get a lucky wheel spin everyday once.So yeah really boring and its a waiting time lol

Fun game overall for people who like RPG in general, lots of funny references. But very, very slow pace compared to current online games. It's more of a social game when joining a guild, and just some very casual game on which you can spend 20s every 30 minutes from work or while alt+tabbing from another online thing.  And no, it's not really pay to win, while it sure makes things easier, a LOT of top players have never spent a $ on this. What makes people win is time, time, and more time, paying for anything really gives nothing but a tiny tiny one-time boost.  Also, for those who says this kind of games has no place on Steam, one reason they probably never thought about: for people who don't have, and don't want to have Flash installed, having them here is great :)

Shakes and Fidget is the ultimate waiting game. You click a bit here, click a bit there, wait, rinse and repeat. It's basically the same cycle of clicks every time. You could call it grinding, if you want to, but I think there's way too much waiting and too mindless to be called grinding. Heck, even games where you can skip scenes/sweep to gain xp, gold, or items are less mindless than literally just letting this game run in the background while you do other stuff. In the 13 hours or so I've 'played' this game, less than an hour was actually spent with the screen in front of me. It's *that much* of a waiting game. There aren't even any achievements.  It has it's good points as well, I'll have to admit. Art is cute and the text can be quite humorous. But there's no actual plot, there aren't any actual things that you *need* to do to progress, and there's just... waiting. The graphics and aesthetic doesn't make the lack of actual content disappear.  I'll keep it installed simply because I'm that kind of person, and by that, I mean the kind of person that doesn't mind waiting. But I know most people would even loathe to call this a game, satire or not, so I guess Shakes and Fidget is not a game I can recommend.

If you like watching your other games update for hours at a time, this is the perfect game for you. Otherwise you should pass on this one. You choose a mission from the tavern, wait for the progress bar to fill, and watch the automated combat. Check the store for better equipment, rinse and repeat. It is a lot of waiting for no actual gameplay.

At first, I thought this game sounded cool. It looked like a fun, cartoony RPG that had a feel like computerized Munchkin. Unfortunately, once I started playing, I realized that this game is unbelievably boring.  This game seems to consist of perpetual grinding to reach some unacheivable level in the hopes that the game might eventually get interesting. All you do is accept quests, wait five minutes for it to load, and then watch a fight play out (a fight which you have no control over) and then you go and do it all again. Or, if you're feeling adventurous, you can go to the Arena and get paired against another player who hopelessly, hilariously outguns you, and lose twice the honor you gained in your previous NPC fights. You can buy weapons, armor, and potions that up your stats, but they're expensive and give barely-noticeable boons. Supposedly, you can start building a fortress, or go fight in dungeons, but it won't give me any fortress points to start building or keys to start pillaging dungeons.  This game seems entirely pointless to me. All I end up doing is checking emails while I wait for fights to load. The only props I can give this game is that the artwork is legitimately beautiful--you can stare at it for ten minutes while you wait for your fights to load.  1.5 out of 10

This game has an energy bar which you have to use the cash currency to fill in order to quest. You do get drops of that currency in game but not often enough to even keep playing if that is all you spend it on.
0 gameplay 0/10 would not waste time staring at a countdown timer again

This is a click farm game that you can find on Facebook. You choose from 3 classes and 8 races to make your character. I started off as a Demon Mage but I realized that stats could be bought with gold in the game. Overall, it isn't as much of a game and is more of click fest or time/money sink.   PROS 1. Easy to Understand Very intuitive, go to the Tavern for Quests.  2. Nice Graphics Simple web comic quality.  CONS 1. Pay To Win The in-game cash currency is called Mushrooms. You go to a shady dealer to pay cash for shrooms.  2. Shops You need to use 1 Mushroom (cash currency) just to refresh the shop.  3. Boring Stats and Classes 3 Classes Mage, Warrior and Scout   8 races  Orc (Strength +1, Dexterity -1)  Elf (Strength -1, Dexterity +2, Constitution -1) Gnome (Strength -1, Dexterity +3, Intelligence -1, Constitution -1) Demon (Strength +3, Dexterity -1, Constitution +1, Luck -3) Human (No changes) Dwarf (Dexterity -2, Intelligence -1, Constitution +2, Luck +1) Dark Elf (Strength -2, Dexterity +2, Intelligence +1, Constitution -1) Goblin (Strength -2, Dexterity +2, Constitution -1, Luck +1)  4. Auto Attack You just hit the enemies with automatically. No skill or challenge.
This game is too suck

7 day playing, game server crash almost every day couple time but nothing to worry about then after 7 day server crash and no acc was found ....   but what do you expect form free to play ...   no mone y .. no game ...
10/10 would uninstall again

This game is just a simple idle game, that doesn't feel like an idle game. Progression occurs when you assign your character to a quest (for exp, gold and possibly loot (of course)) or work (for gold). The way this game is made, it's meant to be played with another game, or can be played seriously if you have nothing to play.  Pros: - RPG progression instead of time-based progression. - Character costumization.  Cons: - Almost no sound (only attack sound) - Waiting game, just like mobile games these days where you press fight and let the system do the thing. - Little ways (to none) to communicate with other players  I wish Steam allows neutral rating reviews, because I love idle games, yet it will turn most players down because its a waiting game, with little interaction to do and with almost no way to communicate with other players (yet they still call this as an MMO).
Took my money, but didn't give me my mushrooms and won't reply to my tickets. Steam should not support a game that scams people out of their money. :/

NOTE: My steam time doesn't represent my actual time (add about 100 more hours and you get the picture).  Ah, Shakes and Fidget, my old friend. I actually remember playing this back in (about) 2008-2010. So far, it's aged well, so lets get into it.  (((After Replaying)))  ... ... Ok... let me explain. If idle games aren't your cup of tea, don't do this game (I do idle games because it gives me a small reprieve from doing work), but if idle games are your thing, good for you. Obviously, this game is pay-to-play (even though you have the ability to play without spending a dime, but spending money makes it a hell of a lot easier) and the 'funny, quirky humor' isn't in the game at all. Yes, the game does have its moments, but it's far and few between. I'm personally, still going to play this game because hey, freedom, but this isn't the best game out there (just a semi-par). I do admire the artwork and the comics, though. One suggestion I have is to input a little D&D minigame to add to the quirkiness and humor. Anyways, this game isn't meant for everyone, even though I want to give this game a good review, I can't (although, I still will play it).
